content.question:
The following boxplot summarizes the heights of a sample of 100 trees growing on a tree farm.

Emily claims that a tree height of 43 inches is an outlier for the distribution. Based on the <math alttext="1.5 times I Q R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.5</mn><mo>×</mo><mtext>IQR</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> rule for outliers, is there evidence to support the claim?

choices.label: Yes, because <math alttext="open parenthesis, maximum minus Q 3, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>max</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mo>−</mo><mtext>Q3</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is greater than <math alttext="open parenthesis, Q 1 minus minimum, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>Q</mtext><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>min</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Yes, because 43 is greater than <math alttext="open parenthesis, Q 3 plus I Q R, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>Q</mtext><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><mtext>IQR</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Yes, because 43 is greater than <math alttext="open parenthesis, Q 1 minus 1.5 times I Q R, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>Q</mtext><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>1.5</mn><mo>×</mo><mtext>IQR</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

No, because 43 is not greater than <math alttext="open parenthesis, Q 3 plus 1.5 times I Q R, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>Q</mtext><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>1.5</mn><mo>×</mo><mtext>IQR</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

No, because 43 is greater than <math alttext="open parenthesis, Q 1 minus 1.5 times I Q R, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>Q</mtext><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>1.5</mn><mo>×</mo><mtext>IQR</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: No, because 43 is not greater than <math alttext="open parenthesis, Q 3 plus 1.5 times I Q R, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>Q</mtext><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>1.5</mn><mo>×</mo><mtext>IQR</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 1.7: Summary Statistics for a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
